The Trustee may appoint a bank or trust company to act as Certificate Registrar. A registration book shall be maintained for the Certificates (and Lower Tier REMIC 1 Uncertificated Regular Interests, as the case may be) collectively. The Certificate Registrar may resign or be discharged or removed and a new successor may be appointed in accordance with the procedures and requirements set forth in Sections 6.06 and 6.07 hereof with respect to the resignation, discharge or removal of the Trustee and the appointment of a successor Trustee. The Certificate Registrar may appoint, by a written instrument delivered to the Holders, any NIMS Insurer and the Master Servicer, any bank or trust company to act as co-registrar under such conditions as the Certificate Registrar may prescribe; provided, however, that the Certificate Registrar shall not be relieved of any of its duties or responsibilities hereunder by reason of such appointment. The Lower Tier REMIC 1 Uncertificated Regular Interests may only be transferred in whole and not in part to no more than one LTURI-holder at a time who is either (1) an affiliate of the Master Servicer or (2) a trustee of a privately placed securitization. The Trustee and the Depositor shall treat the Person in whose name the Lower Tier REMIC 1 Uncertificated Regular Interests are registered on the books of the Certificate Registrar as the LTURI-holder for all purposes hereunder.
